summary.long: 2 Timothy is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that I have thee in remembrance in my prayers night and day without ceasing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I greatly desire to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice and,I am persuaded, is in thee also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God which is in thee through the putting on of my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me His prisoner; but be thou a partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel according to the power of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who hath saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but in accordance with His own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before the world began,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but is now made manifest by the appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death and hath brought life and immortality to light through the Gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this I am appointed a preacher and an apostle and a teacher of the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which cause I also suffer these things; nevertheless I am not ashamed. For I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that He is able to keep that which I have committed unto Him against that Day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold fast to the form of sound words, which thou hast heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That good thing which was committed unto thee, keep, by the Holy Ghost who dwelleth in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This thou knowest, that all those who are in Asia have turned away from me, among whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently and found me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy from the Lord in that Day! And in how many things he ministered unto me in Ephesus,thou knowest very well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the things that thou hast heard from me among many witnesses, commit thou the same to faithful men who shall be able to teach others also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Endure thou therefore hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man who warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life, that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if also a man strive for masteries, yet he is not crowned unless he strive lawfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The husbandman who laboreth must be the first partaker of the fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider what I say, and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my Gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherein I suffer trouble as an evildoer, even unto bonds. But the Word of God is not bound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I endure all things for the elect’s sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with Him, we shall also live with Him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we suffer, we shall also reign with Him. If we deny Him, He also will deny us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we believe not, yet He abideth faithful; He cannot deny Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit but to the subverting of the hearers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Study to show thyself approved unto God, a workman who needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But shun profane and vain babblings, for they will increase unto more ungodliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their word will eat as doth a canker — among whom are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already, and overthrowing the faith of some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal: “The Lord knoweth those who are His,” and, “Let every one who nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth, and some to honor and some to dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honor, sanctified and meet for the Master’s use, and prepared for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Flee also youthful lusts; but follow righteousness, faith, charity, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they engender strifes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant of the Lord must not engender strife, but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in meekness instructing those in opposition. Perhaps God will give them repentance, that they may acknowledge the truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This know also: that in the last days perilous times shall come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, without selfcontrol, fierce, despisers of those who are good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: traitors, headstrong, haughty, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a form of godliness but denying the power thereof. From such turn away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For of this sort are those who creep into houses and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ever learning and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth — men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shall proceed no further, for their folly shall be manifest unto all men, as theirs also was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecutions, afflictions which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra — what persecutions I endured. But out of them all, the Lord delivered me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and all who will live a godly life in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing from whom thou hast learned them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that from childhood thou hast known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Scripture is given by inspiration of God and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly equipped for all good works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charge thee therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at His appearing and His Kingdom:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: preach the Word; be instant in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but having itching ears, they shall heap to themselves teachers in accordance with their own lusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned toward fables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, fulfill thy ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have fought a good fight; I have finished my course; I have kept the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness which the Lord, the righteous Judge, shall give me on that Day — and not to me only, but unto all those also who love His appearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Use diligence to come shortly unto me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and has departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark and bring him with thee, for he is profitable to me for the ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil; the Lord reward him according to his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware thou also of him, for he hath greatly withstood our words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me. I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, the Lord stood with me and strengthened me, that by me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear. And I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work and will preserve me unto His heavenly Kingdom, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute Prisca and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Erastus remained at Corinth, but Trophimus I have left sick at Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Try with diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
